node.title: Deputy PM says apology issued over ‘incident’ at Nationals Christmas party involving NT Senator
node.alt: NT Senator Sam McMahon speaking to the media at a press conference, looking serious.
node.description: The office of Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce confirms an apology has been received after an incident at a Canberra pub where one witness told the ABC that Senator McMahon threw several punches towards Nationals federal director Jonathan Hawkes.
node.content:
["The Deputy Prime Minister's office says an apology has been issued over an \"incident\" at a Nationals Christmas party involving Northern Territory Senator Sam McMahon.", "Members of the party were meeting at the Kingston Hotel in Canberra on Thursday night.", "A witness, who asked to remain anonymous, has told the ABC the alleged incident occurred as colleagues were putting Senator McMahon into a taxi.", "They say they saw Senator McMahon\u00a0throw several punches towards Nationals federal director Jonathan Hawkes.", "Following questions from the media, Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce's office issued a statement.", "\"The Deputy Prime Minister has been advised that there was an incident at the Christmas party on Thursday night,\" a spokesperson said.", "\"A contrite apology has been given and accepted.", "", "
Nationals federal director\u00a0Jonathan Hawkes.(ABC News)
", "\"Both parties have explicitly said they want this to be the end of the issue and, out of respect for them, this will be adhered to by our office.\"", "The ABC contacted Senator McMahon, but she did not respond.", "Her office has advised she will not be commenting on the matter.", "", "
Senator Sam McMahon\u00a0failed\u00a0to win the CLP's\u00a0preselection race for the upcoming federal election.(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "The CLP senator, who sits with the Nationals in Canberra, is currently in home quarantine in the NT.", "She was elected to the Senate in 2019 after replacing CLP stalwart Nigel Scullion.", "In June, Senator McMahon lost a preselection battle to be the party's top Senate candidate at the next federal election.", "She was defeated by Jacinta Price, the former deputy mayor of Alice Springs, who ran as the CLP's candidate for Lingiari in the 2019 federal election, but lost to Labor MP Warren Snowdon.", "In the week before the preselection battle, Senator McMahon denied allegations she was drunk on the floor of the Senate, labelling the claims part of a political campaign to undermine her chances in the contest."]
